description: Returning to your community after a period of incarceration or suffering the consequences of a criminal conviction on your record can be difficult. Fortunately there are people and programs who can help. This site is intended to help you locate resources and assistance in Western North Carolina.

A good place to start is the Federal Interagency Reentry Council’s Reentry MythBusters which dispels common myths about what federal benefits you may be able to access, even if you’ve been convicted of a felony.
On this site you will find information about housing, jobs, public benefits, healthcare, legal issues, reentry support programs and more.

Maintenance of this site is a volunteer effort. We do our best to keep the information here up to date, but we do not make any guarantees about the accuracy of the information here or on sites linked from this site.

This site is a collaborative effort. Contributors include Code for Asheville and Code for Greensboro; Pisgah Legal Services; and Christiana Glenn Tugman of the City of Asheville and the Community Resource Council of Swannanoa.
